description:
Ph0wn is a local CTF dedicated to smart devices (e.g drones, connected toothbrush, weather station etc).

This CTF is not online: you need to be physically present to borrow some of the connected objects for instance.

The event is sponsored by Fortinet. Other sponsors to be announced.
title: ph0wn CTF 2018

description:
X-MAS CTF is HTSP's first CTF and its purpose is learning and having fun going through jeopardy style challenges! We welcome both beginners and experienced alike! Hope you will have a great time and we wish you a Merry Christmas! (All of the challenges were written by HTSP members)

The following rules apply for the X-MAS CTF 2018:
•    Attacking the web server is strictly prohibited and will get you disqualified.
•    The flag format is X-MAS{1337_Str1ng}, unless specified otherwise. 
•    The competition will be over on Fri, 21 Dec. 2018 at 18:00 UTC but the challenges will be online for the following 2-3 days afterwards.
•    Bruteforcing the flag will not get you anywhere except on the black list.
•    Any questions regarding challenges or the platform should be sent to htspcontact@gmail.com.

Join our official Discord channel for further details! https://discord.gg/zCGE9j7
title: X-MAS CTF 2018

description:
Test your knowledge and skills in targeted attacks, Internet of Things (IoT), Industrial Control Systems (ICS), and other cybersecurity issues.

The competition is comprised of an online qualifying event and finals held in Tokyo, Japan in December 2018.

The top ten teams from the online qualifier will advance to compete in the final to be played with a combination of “attack and defense” and “Jeopardy” formats.

Final
Program: Attack and Defense
(King-of-the-Hill and“Jeopardy” Style)
Dates: December 15 - 16, 2018
Language: English (with Japanese support)
Venue: CIRQ – Tokyo, Japan
Participants: (Maximum four members per group)
Top ten (10) teams from the Online Qualifier
Automatic qualification: Winners from regional events are eligible for participating in Trend Micro CTF 2018 - Raimund Genes Cup - The Final
Arab Regional Cyber Security CTF Competition 2018
Latin America Regional CTF
Europe Regional CTF
Travel expenses covered for top ten teams:
Up to JPY 200,000* (approx. 1,800 USD) per team
Three nights accommodations** for the duration of the final
All team members must be age 20 or older to participate

* Conditions apply
** Accommodation arranged by Trend Micro
title: Trend Micro CTF 2018 - Raimund Genes Cup - The Final

description:
Hi CTFers,

we're happy to announce our 7th incarnation of the C3 CTF, which will be held during the 35th Chaos Communication Congress in Leipzig. This Jeopardy style CTF is open to everyone and can be played online. It will start on Dec. 27, 20:00 UTC and last 48h until Dec. 29, 20:00 UTC. As always, don't try to ruin other people's fun.

There will be pwnage!

Also, with high probability, there will be a Junior version of the CTF like last year, announced separately. It will not be on CTFtime, so check out our website for updates.

IRC: #35c3ctf@hackint.eu

Twitter: @EatSleepPwnRpt
title: 35C3 CTF

description: The FireShell CTF is a Brazilian event in jeopardy style, friendly beginner. The proposal is to test participants' hacking skills in a challenging yet fun environment.
title: FireShell CTF 2019

description:
A Middle School focused CTF, 
Everyone is free to join in the fun, but Middle school students are judged separately for prizes
title: NeverLAN CTF 2019

description:
ARE YOU READY FOR AN EXTRAORDINARY CTF?
-FROM THE CREATORS OF THE GAME OF PWNERS-

SOC Battle is a CTF (Capture the Flag) competition which is organizing by Prisma CSI, Binalyze and Picus Security, and prepared for the SOC teams all over the world. It is completely free to join. Purpose of the competition is taking SOC teams to higher levels and give them a chance to compare themselves with the other SOC teams on all over the world through scenario based questions.

Only defence based questions will be included in the competition. Cyber security incidents, breaches and malwares that SOC teams can face in the real world will be turned into questions by the CTF team.

QUESTION CATEGORIES

FORENSICS
THREAT INTELLIGENCE
OPEN SOURCE INTELLIGENCE
MALWARE ANALYSIS
INCIDENT RESPONSE
CRYPTOLOGY
LOG MANAGEMENT

In each round, questions from the categories mentioned above will be prepared and given competitors to solve. The scores of the competition and rounds will be kept seperately. The team which reaches the highest point in total will be the winner of the competition.
title: SOC Battle

description: Registrations will open a week or two before the CTF
title: Evlz CTF

description:
In support of STEM outreach, MITRE and our partners are hosting the 8th annual national Capture the Flag (CTF) competition.

This CTF competition aims to encourage and promote interest in cybersecurity. United States-based High school and undergraduate college students will have the opportunity to compete in cybersecurity challenges to gain real-life experience and win national coverage to make a huge impact on our cyber talent pipelines.

Learn: Fundamental cyber knowledge by using online resources from MITRE and other publicly available reputable sources.

Understand: Binary exploitation and reversing, web exploitation, computer/network forensics, cryptography, critical infrastructure protection/exploitation and more!
Practice: Using Web resources and training challenges powered by the MITRE Cyber Academy.

Compete: Against students in high school and undergraduate universities across the nation.

Win: Priority consideration for a cyber internship.

Notable industry and academic experts have partnered together to design rigorous challenges for students to solve. Participating in teams of four or five, students will gain valuable experience, skills and tools throughout this nationwide competition.
title: STEM CTF: Cyber Challenge 2019

description:
VolgaCTF is an international interuniversity cybersecurity competition organised by a group of IT enthusiasts in collaboration with the Institute of Informatics, Mathematics and Electronics of Samara University.

VolgaCTF 2019 Qualifier is an online competition. Top teams will be invited to participate in VolgaCTF 2019 Final, which will be held in Samara, Russia.
title: VolgaCTF 2019 Qualifier
